header.title: THE WATCHER
authors: New Zealand Voice of The Left-Hand Path

central_thesis: The document serves as a forum for the Left-Hand Path, primarily advocating for a philosophical and practical embrace of Satanism as a path of rebellion against tyrannical religious and moral concepts (specifically Judeo-Christianity). It reinterprets biblical narratives and figures like Satan and the Watchers as symbols of human liberation and ascent, while also contextualizing modern Satanism with Aleister Crowley's Thelemic cosmology.

structure_content.summary: Establishes the journal's purpose as a forum for Left-Hand Path opinions. Defines the Watchers (led by Azazel) and Satan as symbols of rebellion against Jehovah and oppressive moral concepts, promoting individual biological, spiritual, and intellectual ascent. Declares allegiance to liberty and progress.

structure_content.chapter_title: THE BIBLE IN THE BALANCE PART I: MARRIAGE & BLOOD SACRIFICE
structure_content.summary: Critiques Judeo-Christian scriptures to argue that blood sacrifice and problematic views on marriage are sanctioned by Jehovah, not unique to Satanism. It cites biblical examples (Cain and Abel, various animal and human sacrifices, Jesus' teachings on family division, and Paul's views on marriage) to highlight alleged hypocrisies and demonstrate that these concepts originate within Judeo-Christianity.

Examines Aleister Crowley's relationship with Satanism, quoting his 'Hymn to Lucifer' and discussing his cosmological integration of Satan/Shaitan. It clarifies Crowley's view that 'The Devil' is historically defined by those who dislike a god, but in Thelema, equates to Aiwaz (Holy Guardian Angel), the Sun-Father, and the life-flaming cosmic energy, rejecting simplistic devil-worship accusations.

Provides contact information for several Satanic and Left-Hand Path organizations active at the time (1990), including the Church of Satan, The Black Flame, Church of S.A.T.A.N., The Raven School/Church of the Raven, Order of the Nine Angles, and The 88 Temple Ov Deities. It also lists resources for purchasing materials related to Satanism.

key_concepts.definition: A philosophical and spiritual orientation characterized by rebellion against conventional religious authority and moral concepts, emphasizing individual biological, spiritual, and intellectual ascent. It champions self-deification, freedom, and personal progress over adherence to external dogmas.

A fabled Order, led by Azazel and instigated by Satan, who rebelled against Jehovah and descended to Earth to interact with humanity. They are depicted as teachers of magic, botany, metallurgy, and cosmetics. They symbolize rebellion, progress, and the divine-human interaction outside of Yahwistic control.

Symbolizes rebellion against tyrannical deities and stifling moralities, viewed as a 'free-thinker' and 'Saviour' who inspires disobedience for human liberation. In Crowley's Thelemic cosmology, Shaitan is equated with Aiwaz (the Holy Guardian Angel), the 'Devil' as a cosmic force (FIAOF, Sun-Father), and the source of life-flaming cosmic energy, not a simplistic evil entity.

A practice, often attributed to Satanism, which the text argues is extensively sanctioned and demanded by the Judaeo-Christian God in biblical narratives (e.g., Abel's offering, post-birth purification rites, Jephthah's daughter, Saul's sons). The text positions it as a 'hangover from the primitive past' present in both pagan and Judeo-Christian traditions.

A central concept in Aleister Crowley's Thelema, signifying a new age in humanity's spiritual evolution. Within this Aeon, the 'Devil' (Satan/Shaitan) is recognized as a vital component of the formula FIAOF, representing the 'exalted Devil' or the secret Eye (phallic worship), understood as an integral aspect of cosmic and individual manifestation.

practical_system.description: The document outlines a philosophical and ideological system for Left-Hand Path adherents, centered on rebellion against 'tyrannical god and moral concepts' (primarily Judeo-Christianity) and the pursuit of 'continuing human ascent' (biological, spiritual, intellectual). It draws inspiration from the rebellious symbolism of the Watchers and Satan, advocating a critical re-reading of religious texts to expose perceived hypocrisies. It incorporates elements of Aleister Crowley's Thelema, particularly his redefinition of 'the Devil' as a cosmic force and an aspect of the Holy Guardian Angel, thereby providing a sophisticated metaphysical framework for a modern Satanic practice. While not a step-by-step grimoire, it lays the ideological groundwork for a praxis of self-liberation and empowerment through defiance of conventional norms.
tools: Philosophical texts and critical analysis of religious scriptures
Symbolic figures: Satan, Azazel, The Watchers, Lucifer, Shaitan
Thelemic concepts and cosmology (Aeon of Horus, FIAOF)
rituals: Crowley's ritual for the Attainment of Knowledge and Conversation of his Holy Guardian Angel
Crowley's ritual of the Mark of the Beast (to invoke Aeon of Horus energies)
General 'Satanic Rites & Ceremonies' as practiced by listed organizations.

relevant_quotes.text: 'Satan is the first free-thinker and Saviour of the world. He frees Adam and impresses the seal of humanity and liberty on his forehead by making him disobedient.' - Mikhail Bakunin, Russian anarchist philosopher.

'Crowley's philosophy takes a bit from here and a bit from there... but... he was more a Satanist than anything else. 'I serve my great Master Satan', he wrote in one of his franker confessions, 'and that august Council composed of Beelzebub, Lucifuge, Asmodeus, Belphegor, Baal, Adrammelech, Lilith and Nahema.': (John Symonds, The Great Beast).

'With my Hawk's head I peck at the eyes of Jesus as he hangs upon the cross. 'I flap my wings in the face of Mohammed and blind him. 'With my claws I tear out the flesh of the Indian and the Buddhist, Mongol and Din. 'Bahlasti! Ompehda! I spit on your crapulous creeds. 'Let Mary inviolate be torn upon wheels: for her sake let all chaste women be utterly despised among you!' (Liber AL).

critical_analysis.relevance: This document is highly relevant for understanding the foundational philosophy and early community-building efforts of a specific Left-Hand Path group in New Zealand during the late 20th century. It provides a historical snapshot of how Satanic philosophy was articulated, defended, and disseminated at the time, particularly through a critical re-evaluation of Abrahamic scriptures. Its integration of Crowleyan Thelema into a broader Satanic discourse demonstrates the syncretic nature of modern occult movements, while the directory serves as a valuable resource for mapping the early global Satanic network.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of individuals interested in or actively practicing Left-Hand Path traditions, particularly Satanism and Thelema. This includes those seeking intellectual and spiritual alternatives to mainstream religions, practitioners interested in occult history and philosophy, and researchers studying modern occultism, anti-clerical movements, and the historical development of Satanic thought. It specifically caters to those who identify with rebellion, individual sovereignty, and a critical analysis of conventional morality.
